location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 35/86 I A 32 Muscat Commercial Treaty, 1891: revision of 1905'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: The foliation system in use is the sequence of numbers appearing in a circle in the top right hand corner of each folio. The file also bears a former foliation system comprising of uncircled numbers.

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning the Muscat Commercial Treaty of 1891 and its revision in 1905. Includes drafts of the treaty articles with comments in the margins on possible amendments as well as the final signed agreement. A letter discusses the wish of the Sultan to be addressed as His Majesty. Correspondents include Ronald Evelyn Wingate, Political Agent, Muscat; Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; Taimur bin Faisal [Taymūr ibn Fayṣal], Sultan of Muscat; Deputy Secretary to the Government of India.

subject.topic: Treaty of Friendship, Commerce and Navigation between Great Britain and Muscat (1891)
